content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

To create the `add_yearmonth` function, you can use the ` Dates.month` and `Dates.year` functions to extract the year and month. Then concatenate them into a new integer.

Here's the function definition:

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[!,:ym] = map(x -> parse(Int, "$(Dates.year(x))$(Dates.month(x))")) , df[:dt])
    return df
end
```

This function takes a DataFrame `df` and adds a new column `ym` with the concatenated year and month integers.

To use this function, you can call it with your DataFrame:

```julia
df = DataFrame(dt = [datetime(2023, 1, 1)), datetime(2023, 2, 1))])
df = add_yearmonth(df)
```

This will add the `ym` column to the DataFrame `df`.
